meanings.definition: The modification of stamens into petal-like structures in a flower.
meanings.sent1: The staminody of the flower made it look like it had extra petals.
meanings.sent2: The staminody of the lily added a unique touch to its appearance.
meanings.sent3: The staminody of the rose confused the bees, thinking they found more nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed like the staminody of a blooming tulip.
meanings.sent5: The staminody of the daisy stood out among the other flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: The presence of staminodes in a plant.
meanings.sent1: The staminody of the plant attracted pollinators with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The staminody of the orchid fascinated botanists studying the plant.
meanings.sent3: The staminody of the sunflower made it the envy of the garden.
meanings.sent4: His words bloomed in her heart like the staminody of a blossoming tree.
meanings.sent5: The staminody of the cactus surprised many with its delicate beauty.

meanings.sent1: The staminody of the shrub made it a favorite among gardeners.
meanings.sent2: The staminody of the daffodil added an elegant touch to the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The staminody of the fern made it a sought-after plant for landscaping.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like the staminody of a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: The staminody of the palm tree swayed gracefully in the breeze.
